member.name: IMFSample.AddBuffer
member.summary: Adds a buffer to the end of the list of buffers in the sample.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSample.ConvertToContiguousBuffer
member.summary: Converts a sample with multiple buffers into a sample with a single buffer.
member.param: Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The sample does not contain any buffers.

member.name: IMFSample.CopyToBuffer
member.summary: Copies the sample data to a buffer. This method concatenates the valid data from all of the buffers of the sample, in order.
member.param: Pointer to the interface of the destination buffer. The buffer must be large enough to hold the valid data in the sample. To get the size of the data in the sample, call .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The buffer is not large enough to contain the data.

member.name: IMFSample.GetBufferByIndex

summary.para: Gets a buffer from the sample, by index.
summary.div: Note In most cases, it is safer to use the method. If the sample contains more than one buffer, the ConvertToContiguousBuffer method replaces them with a single buffer, copies the original data into that buffer, and returns the new buffer to the caller. The copy operation occurs at most once. On subsequent calls, no data is copied.

member.param: Index of the buffer. To find the number of buffers in the sample, call . Buffers are indexed from zero.
Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: NULL pointer argument, or the index is out of range.

member.name: IMFSample.GetBufferCount
member.summary: Retrieves the number of buffers in the sample.
member.param: Receives the number of buffers in the sample. A sample might contain zero buffers.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSample.GetSampleDuration
member.summary: Retrieves the duration of the sample.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The sample does not have a specified duration.

summary.para: Retrieves flags associated with the sample.

Currently no flags are defined. Instead, metadata for samples is defined using attributes. To get attributes from a sample, use the interface, which inherits. For a list of sample attributes, see Sample Attributes.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSample.GetSampleTime
member.summary: Retrieves the presentation time of the sample.
member.param: Receives the presentation time, in 100-nanosecond units.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The sample does not have a presentation time.

member.name: IMFSample.GetTotalLength
member.summary: Retrieves the total length of the valid data in all of the buffers in the sample. The length is calculated as the sum of the values retrieved by the method.
member.param: Receives the total length of the valid data, in bytes.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSample.RemoveAllBuffers
member.summary: Removes all of the buffers from the sample.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSample.RemoveBufferByIndex
member.summary: Removes a buffer at a specified index from the sample.
member.param: Index of the buffer. To find the number of buffers in the sample, call . Buffers are indexed from zero.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSample.SetSampleDuration
member.summary: Sets the duration of the sample.
member.param: Duration of the sample, in 100-nanosecond units.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets flags associated with the sample.

Currently no flags are defined. Instead, metadata for samples is defined using attributes. To set attributes on a sample, use the interface, which inherits. For a list of sample attributes, see Sample Attributes.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSample.SetSampleTime
member.summary: Sets the presentation time of the sample.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.
